2024-2025 Shepherd University Catalog

Chemistry, B.S.

Print-Friendly Page (opens a new window)
Facebook this Page (opens a new window)
Tweet this Page (opens a new window)

The chemistry program is designed to meet the needs of future chemists as well as students seeking graduate degrees in the sciences or professional degrees in pharmacy or medicine, dental, or veterinary fields.  The curriculum is rooted in the five traditional areas of chemistry - analytical, physical, inorganic, organic, and biochemistry and emphasizes both physics and calculus as part of the degree.  Each student will also gain independent research skills by carrying out an individualized in-lab project as the capstone and writing in the major course.

Chemistry offers multiple concentrations to fit each student’s goals: Traditional Track (with choice of a minor), Biochemistry (comprehensive), Biopharmaceutical Sciences (comprehensive), and Environmental Chemistry (comprehensive).

Major in Chemistry–Traditional Concentration

Curriculum for a Major in Chemistry–Traditional Concentration

Specific Core Curriculum requirements, 12 Hours:

  • MATH 207 - Calculus I (4 cr)

  •  

  • PHYS 201 - College Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 201L - College Physics I Laboratory (1 cr) and
  • PHYS 202 - College Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 202L - College Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

  • OR

  • PHYS 221 - General Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 221L - General Physics I Laboratory (1 cr) and
  • PHYS 222 - General Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 222L - General Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

Total hours required, 49 Hours:

Required Chemistry Courses, 42 Hours:

  • CHEM 207 - General Chemistry I (3 cr)
  • CHEM 207L - General Chemistry I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 209 - General Chemistry II (3 cr)
  • CHEM 209L - General Chemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 301 - Inorganic Chemistry (3 cr)
  • CHEM 315 - Organic Chemistry I (3cr)
  • CHEM 315L - Organic Chemistry I Laboratory (1cr)
  • CHEM 316 - Organic Chemistry II (3 cr each)
  • CHEM 316L - Organic Chemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 321 - Analytical Chemistry (3 cr)
  • CHEM 321L - Analytical Chemistry Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 322 - Instrumental Analysis (3 cr)
  • CHEM 322L - Instrumental Analysis Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 325 - Computers in Science (3 cr)
  • CHEM 340 - Physical Chemistry I (3cr)
  • CHEM 340L - Physical Chemistry I Laboratory (1cr)
  • CHEM 440 - Physical Chemistry II (3cr)
  • CHEM 450 - Research in Chemistry (1-3 cr) Must earn a total of 4 credits.

  •  

  • CHEM 301L - Inorganic Chemistry Lab (1cr)
  • OR  CHEM 440L - Physical Chemistry II Laboratory (1cr)

Additional required course, 4 Hours:

  • MATH 208 - Calculus II (4 cr)

Science Elective, 3 Hours

 

  • Any 300-level or above CHEM course excluding CHEM 450 and 490
  • Any 300-level or above PHYS course
  • GSCI 301  
  • GSCI 302  
  • ENVS 390  

 

Four-Year Course Progression

Comprehensive Major in Chemistry– Biochemistry Concentration

Curriculum for a Comprehensive Major in Chemistry–Biochemistry Concentration

Specific Core Curriculum requirements, 11-12 Hours:

  • MATH 314 - Statistics (3 cr)
  • OR  MATH 205 - Calculus With Applications (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 207 - Calculus I (4 cr)

  •  

  • PHYS 201 - College Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 201L - College Physics I Laboratory (1 cr) and
  • PHYS 202 - College Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 202L - College Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

  • OR

  • PHYS 221 - General Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 221L - General Physics I Laboratory (1 cr) and
  • PHYS 222 - General Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 222L - General Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

Total hours required, 69-71 Hours

Core courses, 42 Hours

  • CHEM 207 - General Chemistry I (3 cr)
  • CHEM 207L - General Chemistry I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 209 - General Chemistry II (3 cr)
  • CHEM 209L - General Chemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 315 - Organic Chemistry I (3cr)
  • CHEM 315L - Organic Chemistry I Laboratory (1cr)
  • CHEM 316 - Organic Chemistry II (3 cr each)
  • CHEM 316L - Organic Chemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 321 - Analytical Chemistry (3 cr)
  • CHEM 321L - Analytical Chemistry Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 322 - Instrumental Analysis (3 cr)
  • CHEM 322L - Instrumental Analysis Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 325 - Computers in Science (3 cr)
  • CHEM 329 - Biochemistry I (3 cr)
  • CHEM 329L - Biochemistry I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 330 - Biochemistry II (3 cr)
  • CHEM 330L - Biochemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 340 - Physical Chemistry I (3cr)
  • CHEM 340L - Physical Chemistry I Laboratory (1cr)
  • CHEM 450 - Research in Chemistry (1-3 cr) Must earn a total of 4 credits.

Required Biology Courses, 16 Hours:

  • BIOL 211 - Fundamentals of Biology I: Molecular and Cellular Function (4cr)
  • BIOL 212 - Fundamentals of Biology II: Diversity of Life (4cr)
  • BIOL 305 - Cell Biology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 344 - Genetics (4 cr)

Additional Required Math Courses, 3-4 Hours:

  • MATH 205 - Calculus With Applications (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 207 - Calculus I (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 208 - Calculus II (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 314 - Statistics (3 cr)

Science Electives, 6-8 Hours

  • CHEM 301 - Inorganic Chemistry (3 cr)
  • CHEM 311 - Chemical Pharmacology (3 cr)
  • CHEM 350 - Forensic Chemistry (3cr)
  • CHEM 436 - Advanced Protein Chemistry (3 cr)
  • CHEM 440 - Physical Chemistry II (3cr)
  • BIOL 302 - Microbiology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 363 - Mycology (4cr)
  • BIOL 404 - Immunology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 406 - Developmental Biology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 407 - Genomics and Bioinformatics (4cr)
  • BIOL 416 - Molecular Biology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 418 - Virology (4 cr)

Four-Year Course Progression

Chemistry, Biochemistry Concentration

**Serves as both the Writing in the Major and Capstone requirements         DEGREE TOTAL 122-124
11/17/2020                
         

 

Comprehensive Major in Chemistry-Biopharmaceutical Sciences Concentration

 The biopharmaceutical sciences concentration degree program will prepare Shepherd students for admission into either the School of Pharmacy program at West Virginia University or at Shenandoah University. Those students will receive their bachelor of science degree in chemistry from Shepherd through the transfer of specified first-year pharmacy courses from the WVU School of Pharmacy (SOP) or from the Shenandoah School of Pharmacy (SOP) after successfully completing their first professional year in the pharmacy program.

Curriculum for a Comprehensive Major in Chemistry-Biopharmaceutical Sciences concentration

Specific Core Curriculum Requirements, 14-15 Hours:

  • MATH 205 - Calculus With Applications (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 207 - Calculus I (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 314 - Statistics (3 cr)


  •  

  • PHYS 201 - College Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 201L - College Physics I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • PHYS 202 - College Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 202L - College Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

  • OR

  • PHYS 221 - General Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 221L - General Physics I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • PHYS 222 - General Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 222L - General Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

  •  

  • ECON 205 - Principles of Macroeconomics (3 cr)

Required Shepherd Courses, 57 hours:

  • CHEM 207 - General Chemistry I (3 cr)
  • CHEM 207L - General Chemistry I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 209 - General Chemistry II (3 cr)
  • CHEM 209L - General Chemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)

  •  

  • BIOL 211 - Fundamentals of Biology I: Molecular and Cellular Function (4cr)
  • BIOL 212 - Fundamentals of Biology II: Diversity of Life (4cr)

  •  

  • MATH 205 - Calculus With Applications (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 207 - Calculus I (4 cr)

  •  

  • MATH 314 - Statistics (3 cr)
  • CHEM 315 - Organic Chemistry I (3cr)
  • CHEM 315L - Organic Chemistry I Laboratory (1cr)
  • CHEM 316 - Organic Chemistry II (3 cr each)
  • CHEM 316L - Organic Chemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)
  • BIOL 302 - Microbiology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 305 - Cell Biology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 344 - Genetics (4 cr)
  • CHEM 325 - Computers in Science (3 cr)
  • CHEM 329 - Biochemistry I (3 cr)
  • CHEM 329L - Biochemistry I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 340 - Physical Chemistry I (3cr)
  • CHEM 340L - Physical Chemistry I Laboratory (1cr)
  • CHEM 450 - Research in Chemistry (1-3 cr) **

  • * 3 credits to be completed at WVU-School of Pharmacy

School of Pharmacy courses (transferred back to Shepherd for major), 23-27 Hours:

Depending on the School of Pharmacy attended, students will receive credit for the following in transfer:

 

  • From the WVU School of Pharmacy:

     

  • PHAR 400 - Pharm Practice/Management I (4cr)
  • PHAR 401 - Drug Delivery (5cr)
  • PHAR 403 - Prep of Pharm. Products (2cr)
  • PHAR 414 - Biochemical Pharmacology (4cr)
  • PHAR 415 - Biopharmaceut. and Genomics (4cr)
  • PHAR 416 - Drug Chemistry and Biotech. (3cr)
  • PHAR 445 - Body Function (4cr)


  • From the Shenandoah University School of Pharmacy:
     

  • PHAR 312 - Pharmaceutics I (Calculations) (2cr)
  • PHAR 321 - Biomedical Sciences I (2cr)
  • PHAR 339 - Essentials of Pharmacogenomics (2cr)
  • PHAR 349 - Nonprescription Products (3cr)
  • PHAR 412 - Pharmaceutics II (4cr)
  • PHAR 413 - Pharmaceutics and Compounding (1cr)
  • PHAR 421 - Biomedical Sciences II (3cr)
  • PHAR 437 - Integrated Pathophysiology I (3cr)
  • PHAR 438 - Integrated Pathophysiology II (3cr)


  • From the Marshall University School of Pharmacy:
     

  • PHAR 301 - Biopharmaceutics I (3cr)
  • PHAR 304 - Introduction to Pharmacy I (4cr)
  • PHAR 404 - Disease and Drug Action (4cr)
  • PHAR 410 - Clinical Immunology (1cr)
  • PHAR 411 - Biopharmaceutics II (3cr)
  • PHAR 417 - Immunology and Microbiology (4cr)
  • PHAR 418 - Pharmaceutical Biochemistry (4cr)
  • PHAR 450 - Pharmacy Practice II (4cr)

Four-Year Course Progression

Chemistry, Biopharmaceutical Concentration
FALL   FIRST YEAR     SPRING   FIRST YEAR  
Sub./Course No. Tier Title Credit   Sub./Course No. Tier Title Credit
CHEM 207   General Chemistry I 3   CHEM 209 1 General Chemistry II 3
CHEM 207L   General Chemistry Lab I 1   CHEM 209L 2 General Chemistry Lab II 1
BIOL 211   Fundamentals of Biology I 4   BIOL 212   Fundamentals of Biology II 4
Core Curriculum  1 First-Year Experience (FYEX)  1   Core Curriculum  1 ENGL 102 3
Core Curriculum 1 ENGL 101 3   Core Curriculum  1 Choose AR with advisor 3
Core Curriculum 1 History 3   Core Curriculum 2 Choose WE with advisor 3
    TOTAL 15       TOTAL 17
         
FALL   SECOND YEAR     SPRING   SECOND YEAR  
Sub./Course No. Tier Title Credit   Sub./Course No. Tier Title Credit
CHEM 315   Organic Chemistry I 3   CHEM 316   Organic Chemistry II 3
CHEM 315L   Organic Chemistry I Lab 1   CHEM 316L   Organic Chemistry II Lab 1
BIOL 302   Microbiology 4   BIOL 305   Cell Biology 4
ECON 205   Principles of Macroeconomics (SO-CK/GL) 3   MATH 205 1 Calculus with Applications 4
Core Curriculum 2 Choose SO-CK/GL/MD with advisor 3   Core Curriculum 2 Choose SO-CK/GL/MD with advisor 3
              TOTAL 15
    TOTAL 14          
         
FALL   THIRD YEAR     SPRING   THIRD YEAR  
Sub./Course No. Tier Title Credit   Sub./Course No. Tier Title Credit
CHEM 329   Biochemistry I 3   CHEM 325   Computers in Science 3
CHEM 329L   Biochemistry I Lab 1   CHEM 340   Physical Chemistry I 3
BIOL 344   Genetics 4   CHEM 340L   Physical Chemistry I Lab 1
PHYS 201 1 College Physics I (LS) 1   MATH 314   Statistics 3
PHYS 201L 1 College Physics I Lab (LS) 3   PHYS 202 1 College Physics II (LS) 3
Core Curriculum 2 Choose HM-CK/GL/MD with advisor 3   PHYS 202L 1 College Physics II Lab 1

11/17/2020                
         

 

 

Comprehensive Major in Chemistry–Environmental Chemistry Concentration

Curriculum for a Comprehensive Major in Chemistry–Environmental Chemistry Concentration

Total hours required (including free electives), 120 Hours required:

Specific Core Curriculum requirements, 11-12 Hours:

  • MATH 205 - Calculus With Applications (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 207 - Calculus I (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 314 - Statistics (3 cr)

  •  

  • PHYS 201 - College Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 201L - College Physics I Laboratory (1 cr) AND
  • PHYS 202 - College Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 202L - College Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

  • OR

  • PHYS 221 - General Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 221L - General Physics I Laboratory (1 cr) AND
  • PHYS 222 - General Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 222L - General Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

Required Chemistry Courses, 42 Hours:

  • CHEM 207 - General Chemistry I (3 cr)
  • CHEM 207L - General Chemistry I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 209 - General Chemistry II (3 cr)
  • CHEM 209L - General Chemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 301 - Inorganic Chemistry (3 cr)
  • CHEM 315 - Organic Chemistry I (3cr)
  • CHEM 315L - Organic Chemistry I Laboratory (1cr)
  • CHEM 316 - Organic Chemistry II (3 cr each)
  • CHEM 316L - Organic Chemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 321 - Analytical Chemistry (3 cr)
  • CHEM 321L - Analytical Chemistry Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 322 - Instrumental Analysis (3 cr)
  • CHEM 322L - Instrumental Analysis Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 325 - Computers in Science (3 cr)
  • CHEM 329 - Biochemistry I (3 cr)
  • CHEM 329L - Biochemistry I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 333 - Environmental Chemistry (3 cr)
  • CHEM 333L - Environmental Chemistry Lab (1 cr)
  • CHEM 340 - Physical Chemistry I (3cr)
  • CHEM 340L - Physical Chemistry I Laboratory (1cr)
  • CHEM 450 - Research in Chemistry (1-3 cr) Must earn a total of 4 credits.

Environmental science concentration requirement, 8 Hours:

  • ENVS 201 - Foundations In Environmental Science I (3cr)
  • ENVS 201L - Foundations In Environmental Science I Lab (1cr)
  • ENVS 202 - Foundations In Environmental Science II (3cr)
  • ENVS 202L - Foundations In Environmental Science II Lab (1cr)

Additional Required Math Courses, 3-4 Hours:

  • MATH 205 - Calculus With Applications (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 207 - Calculus I (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 208 - Calculus II (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 314 - Statistics (3 cr)

Science Elective, 12 Hours:

  • CHEM 301L - Inorganic Chemistry Lab (1cr)
  • ENVS 309 - Geomorphology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 342 - Limnology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 362 - Soil Science and Lab (4 cr)
  • ENVS 390 - Geographic Information Systems (4 cr) *
  • ENVS 396 - Photogrammetry and Aerial Systems (4 cr) *
  • ENVS 397 - Advanced GIS and Remote Sensing (4cr) *
  • ENVS 401 - Conservation Ecology (4cr)
  • ENVS 422 - Stream Ecology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 441 - Hydrology and Lab (4 cr)
  • GSCI 301 - Physical Geology (4 cr)
  • GSCI 303 - Meteorology (4 cr)
  • GSCI 306 - Introduction to Oceanography and Laboratory (4 cr)


  • *Only 2 of ENVS 390, ENVS 396, and ENVS 397 may be used toward the major.

Four-Year Course Progression
